turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Hello, how are you? Can you help me?”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Hello! I’m doing well, thank you! I’d be happy to help. What do you need assistance with today?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Então, minha internet parou de funcionar hoje.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Oh, I’m sorry to hear that! Let’s see how we can fix it. Could you let me know if you’re having trouble with a specific device, or is it affecting everything in your house?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “In my house.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Got it, thanks for that. Alright, let me see… Have you tried restarting your router or modem yet?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Yes, yes, I tried, but no, it turned the internet.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: I see, gotcha. In that case, let’s try something else. Have you checked if the cables are securely connected, or maybe if there’s an outage in your area?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “No, it's connected, but not working.”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Alright, I understand. In that case, we might want to check if other devices are connecting as well, or if it’s just one device. Also, have you tried checking the network settings on your device to see if it’s connected to the correct network?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Okay”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Great! Let me know

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “If the service is easy to fix it by today, do I get a return or credit?”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: That’s a good question! Usually, providers do offer credits or refunds if there’s a prolonged outage. You might want to check with your internet service provider’s customer support to confirm their policy.

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “So, can I get this in writing for my record?”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Absolutely! Typically, they can provide you with a written confirmation or a statement detailing any credits or refunds. It’s definitely something you can request from their support team, and they should be able to send it to you via email or even through their online portal.

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Okay, perfect. And can you give me a reference number for this request?”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Of course! Usually, the provider will generate a reference number for you once you contact their support. I’d recommend reaching out directly to them, and they’ll be able to provide that reference number right away. Let me know if you need help with anything else!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: “Okay, so for now that's it. My internet go back today, yeah?”

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: That’s great to hear! I’m glad it’s back up and running. If you need any more help in the future, just let me know. Otherwise, have a wonderful day!
